title.@value: Bipolar type I disorder, currently in partial remission, most recent episode unspecified

definition.@value: Bipolar type I disorder, currently in partial remission, most recent episode unspecified is diagnosed when the definitional requirements for Bipolar type I disorder have been met but there is insufficient information to determine the nature of the most recent mood episode. The full definitional requirements for a mood episode are no longer met but some significant mood symptoms remain.

label.@value: Bipolar type I disorder, currently in partial remission, most recent episode unspecified
